formula: a(n) = 2*2^n/3 -9*3^n/5 +32*8^n/15. - _Antonio Alberto Olivares_, Feb 06 2010Contribution from _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 15 2011: (Start)a(n) = 13*a(n-1) - 46*a(n-2) + 48*a(n-3), n>=3.a(n) = 11*a(n-1) - 24*a(n-2) + 2^n, a(0)=1, a(1)=13.(End)
example: Use Maxima Computer Algebra System to find terms of the sequence: Declare function f(x):= (2/3)*2^x-(9/5)*3^x+(32/15)*8^x; find f(0), f(1), f(x) where x is the term of the sequence. f(0); 1 f(1); 13 f(2); 123 f(3); 1049 f(4); 8603 f(5); 69489 f(6); 557971 f(7); 4470073 f(8); 35779755 f(9); 286296065 f(10); 2290543619 and so on. [From _Antonio Alberto Olivares_, Feb 06 2010]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
